page.title: 06LANDSCAPE
page.content: South Norwood is an old town; there is a fountain at the bottom of South Norwood hill which dates back to 1887. Some of the houses around South Norwood are derilict and have to be rebuilt. In Suffolk Rd. half of a Methodist church was demolished to make space for old peoples' homes. Opposite the old peoples' homes are Stanley halls where clubs and plays are held. Joined on to Stanley Halls there is a school called Stanley Technical. In Holmesdale Rd. there is a well known football club called Crystal Palace. There used to be a canel flowing through South Norwood. Because of the canal the pub called the JOLLY SAILOR was built. Most of the lamposts in South Norwood were gas but have been converted to electricity. In the High Street there are a lot of coal chutes and cellars,
